images.caption: Figure 1:Overview of ChemMAS. A collaborative multi-agent system for evidence-based reaction-condition reasoning from SMILES inputs. ChemMAS demonstrates strong versatility and delivers state-of-the-art performance on reaction condition reasoning.

Figure 2:Architecture of ChemMAS. The left side shows how the General Chemist processes SMILES and Multi-Channel Recall retrieves reaction conditions from the Reaction Base. On the right, candidate conditions are paired and evaluated through Multi-Agent Debate, where four agents with Multi-Step Reasoning select the top-50 conditions via Tournament Selection.

Figure 3:Two-stage Multi-tool Collaborative Training Framework of ChemMAS. Chemical Teaching uses SFT for cold-start training, enabling the LLM to master TIR, and Tool Incentivization employs RL to align the model‚Äôs policy with both answer correctness and collaborative tool usage.
